text.text_translated:
We have questions about the effect of genes on the brain and on language.  
Genes are parts of our body.  
They tell our body what to do.  
A mutation means a change in a gene.  
Researchers found a gene mutation between 200,000 and 100,000 years ago, which seems to have a connection with speaking and how our brain control our mouth and face.  
Monkeys have a similar gene, but they do not have this mutation.  
It is too early.  
We do not know how much effect genes have on language.  
Maybe one day we will find the answers in our DNA.

best_attempt.text_translated:
Genes are parts in our body.  
A mutation is a change in a gene.  
Scientists study the influence of genetics on brain and language development.  
They ask: Did mutations give us language ability?  
They found a mutation 200,000 to 100,000 years ago.  
This mutation helps speaking and brain control of our mouth and face.  
Monkeys have a similar gene but no mutation.  
It is too early to know the effect of our genes.  
Maybe one day we find answers in our DNA.
